title: Spack dev-build -u <phase> marks package as installed whatever the <phase>
body:
Spack dev-build -u <phase> marks package as installed whatever the <phase>

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
$ cd spack
$ . share/spack/setup-env.sh
$ cd ..
$ curl -o pkgconf-1.6.3.tar.xz http://distfiles.dereferenced.org/pkgconf/pkgconf-1.6.3.tar.xz
$ tar -xf pkgconf-1.6.3.tar.xz
$ cd pkgconf-1.6.3
$ spack dev-build -u configure pkgconf@1.6.3
$ spack spec -I pkgconf@1.6.3
$ spack find -p pkgconf@1.6.3
```

### Error Message

Everything runs fine, but `spack spec -I` will show the package as installed.
Then `spack find -p` will return a path that does not exist.  

### Information on your system

Latest Spack@develop, on MacOs and Toss3.

```
* **Spack:** 0.13.4-2143-1c45153e0
* **Python:** 3.7.7
* **Platform:** darwin-mojave-skylake
```

```
* **Spack:** 0.14.2-848-1c45153
* **Python:** 3.7.2
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-broadwell
```

Note: Although pointing to the exact same commit, `spack debug report` gives different info on both spack instances. I haven’t done a fresh clone on darwin, meaning spack version doesn’t seem to update correctly.

### Additional information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
